text: The way to make money is to buy when blood is running in the streets.
author: Baron Rothschild
title: Banking Dynasty Founder

text: Markets can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent.
author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Economist and Investor

text: Rule No. 1: Never lose money. Rule No. 2: Never forget rule No. 1.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Chairman, Berkshire Hathaway

text: In investing, what is comfortable is rarely profitable.
author: Robert Arnott
title: Investment Manager

text: I'd be a bum on the street with a tin cup if the markets were always efficient.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Chairman, Berkshire Hathaway

text: The big money is not in the buying and selling, but in the waiting.
author: Charlie Munger
title: Vice Chairman, Berkshire Hathaway

text: You get recessions, you have stock market declines. If you don't understand that's going to happen, then you're not ready.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Chairman, Berkshire Hathaway

text: The four most dangerous words in investing are 'this time it's different.'
author: Sir John Templeton
title: Templeton Funds Founder

text: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Chairman, Berkshire Hathaway

text: The stock market is a voting machine in the short run, but a weighing machine in the long run.
author: Benjamin Graham
title: The Intelligent Investor

text: I made my money by selling too soon.
author: Bernard Baruch
title: Financier and Political Advisor

text: The market is a pendulum that forever swings between unsustainable optimism and unjustified pessimism.
author: Benjamin Graham
title: The Intelligent Investor

text: It's not whether you're right or wrong that's important, but how much money you make when you're right and how much you lose when you're wrong.
author: George Soros
title: Soros Fund Management

text: The trend is your friend until the end when it bends.
author: Ed Seykota
title: Legendary Trader

text: I'm only rich because I know when I'm wrong.
author: George Soros
title: Soros Fund Management

text: The hard part is discipline, patience and judgment. The actual process of buying and selling is easy.
author: Julian Robertson
title: Tiger Management

text: You have to be very careful about when you buy stocks. If you buy at the wrong time, you can lose a lot of money very quickly.
author: Stanley Druckenmiller
title: Duquesne Capital Management

text: My philosophy is that all stocks are bad. There are no good stocks unless they go up in price.
author: Jesse Livermore
title: Legendary Speculator

text: The elements of good trading are cutting losses, cutting losses, and cutting losses.
author: Ed Seykota
title: Legendary Trader

text: Don't try to catch a falling knife.
author: Wall Street Wisdom
title: Trading Adage

text: Paper money eventually returns to its intrinsic value - zero.
author: Voltaire
title: French Philosopher

text: Gold is money. Everything else is credit.
author: J.P. Morgan
title: Banking Magnate

text: The government solution to a problem is usually as bad as the problem.
author: Milton Friedman
title: Nobel Prize Economist

text: Inflation is taxation without legislation.
author: Milton Friedman
title: Nobel Prize Economist

text: The curious task of economics is to demonstrate to men how little they really know about what they imagine they can design.
author: F.A. Hayek
title: Austrian Economist

text: Sound money is a sine qua non of a free society.
author: Ludwig von Mises
title: Austrian Economist
context: The Theory of Money and Credit

text: The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.
author: Ludwig von Mises
title: Austrian Economist

text: There is no subtler, no surer means of overturning the existing basis of society than to debauch the currency.
author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Economist
context: The Economic Consequences of the Peace

text: The natural progress of things is for liberty to yield and government to gain ground.
author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Founding Father

text: Bitcoin fixes this.
author: Michael Saylor
title: MicroStrategy CEO

text: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.
author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Economist
context: The Economic Consequences of the Peace

text: I just wait until there is money lying in the corner, and all I have to do is go over there and pick it up.
author: Jim Rogers
title: Quantum Fund Co-founder

text: Earning a lot of money is not the key to prosperity. How you handle it is.
author: Paul Tudor Jones
title: Tudor Investment Corp Founder

text: The gold standard did not collapse. Governments abolished it in order to pave the way for inflation.
author: Ludwig von Mises
title: Austrian Economist

text: I make money by selling too soon.
author: Nathan Rothschild
title: Banking Dynasty

text: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Berkshire Hathaway CEO

text: The four most dangerous words in investing are: 'this time it's different.'
author: John Templeton
title: Templeton Funds Founder

text: There can be no other criterion, no other standard than gold. Yes, gold which never changes.
author: Charles de Gaulle
title: French President

text: I never buy at the bottom and I always sell too soon.
author: Nathan Rothschild
title: Banking Dynasty

text: The time to buy is when there's blood in the streets.
author: John Templeton
title: Templeton Funds Founder

text: Our favorite holding period is forever.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Berkshire Hathaway CEO

text: The Constitution is not a living document; it is a dead document that we bring to life through our interpretations.
author: Ron Paul
title: Former Congressman

text: Beware of little expenses; a small leak will sink a great ship.
author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Founding Father

text: More money has been lost reaching for yield than at the point of a gun.
author: Raymond DeVoe Jr.
title: Market Strategist

text: The market can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent.
author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Economist

text: Government is not reason; it is not eloquent; it is force. Like fire, it is a dangerous servant and a fearful master.
author: George Washington
title: First U.S. President

text: The secret to investing is to figure out how much something is worth, and then pay a lot less.
author: Joel Greenblatt
title: Value Investor
context: The Little Book That Beats the Market

text: He who lives by the crystal ball will eat shattered glass.
author: Ray Dalio
title: Bridgewater Associates Founder

text: Only buy something that you'd be perfectly happy to hold if the market shut down for 10 years.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Berkshire Hathaway CEO

text: The hardest thing to judge is what level of risk is safe.
author: George Soros
title: Quantum Fund Founder

text: The way to build long-term returns is through preservation of capital and home runs.
author: Stanley Druckenmiller
title: Former Soros Fund Manager

text: I believe the very best money is made at the market turns. Everyone says you get killed trying to pick tops and bottoms and you make all your money by catching the trends in the middle. Well for twelve years I have often been missing the meat in the middle but I have made a lot of money at tops and bottoms.
author: Paul Tudor Jones
title: Tudor Investment Corporation

text: The biggest mistake investors make is to believe that what happened in the recent past is likely to persist into the future.
author: Ray Dalio
title: Bridgewater Associates

text: In the short run, the market is a voting machine, but in the long run, it is a weighing machine.
author: Benjamin Graham
title: The Intelligent Investor

text: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great at whatever they want to do.
author: Kobe Bryant
title: NBA Legend

text: Markets are constantly in a state of uncertainty and flux and money is made by discounting the obvious and betting on the unexpected.
author: George Soros
title: Hedge Fund Legend

text: I learned early that there is nothing new in Wall Street. There can't be because speculation is as old as the hills.
author: Jesse Livermore
title: Legendary Trader

text: When you combine ignorance and leverage, you get some pretty interesting results.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Berkshire Hathaway

text: The key to trading success is emotional discipline. If intelligence were the key, there would be a lot more people making money trading.
author: Victor Sperandeo
title: Professional Trader

text: Being early is the same thing as being wrong.
author: Howard Marks
title: Oaktree Capital

text: The four most dangerous words in investing are: 'this time it's different.'
author: Sir John Templeton
title: Templeton Funds

text: The stock market is filled with individuals who know the price of everything, but the value of nothing.
author: Philip Fisher
title: Growth Stock Investor

text: Far more money has been lost by investors preparing for corrections, or trying to anticipate corrections, than has been lost in corrections themselves.
author: Peter Lynch
title: Former Fidelity Manager

text: The secret to investing is to figure out the value of something – and then pay a lot less.
author: Joel Greenblatt
title: Gotham Capital
context: The Little Book That Beats the Market

text: Sound money is an essential requirement for the just society.
author: Ludwig von Mises
title: Austrian Economist
context: The Theory of Money and Credit

text: Paper money eventually returns to its intrinsic value – zero.
author: Voltaire
title: French Philosopher

text: Bitcoin is a remarkable cryptographic achievement and the ability to create something which is not duplicable in the digital world has enormous value.
author: Eric Schmidt
title: Former Google CEO

text: Every informed person needs to know about Bitcoin because it might be one of the world's most important developments.
author: Leon Luow
title: Nobel Prize Winner

text: The root problem with conventional currency is all the trust that's required to make it work.
author: Satoshi Nakamoto
title: Bitcoin Creator

text: If you don't believe it or don't get it, I don't have the time to try to convince you, sorry.
author: Satoshi Nakamoto
title: Bitcoin Creator

text: Bitcoin is the first time in human history we have a monetary system that's not controlled by any government or central bank.
author: Michael Saylor
title: MicroStrategy CEO

text: I always believe the markets are always wrong. So you have to take advantage of market inefficiencies.
author: George Soros
title: Quantum Fund Founder

text: Every record has been destroyed or falsified, every book rewritten, every picture has been repainted, every statue and street building has been renamed, every date has been altered.
author: Murray Rothbard
title: Austrian Economist
context: On government manipulation of history and economics

text: There can be no other criterion, no other standard than gold. Yes, gold which never changes, which can be shaped into ingots, bars, coins, which has no nationality and which is eternally and universally accepted as the unalterable fiduciary value par excellence.
author: Charles de Gaulle
title: French President

text: The most important quality for an investor is temperament, not intellect.
author: Warren Buffett
title: Berkshire Hathaway CEO
